intro: Stillingia pachystachya, commonly known as the thick-stemmed stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Stillingia pachystachya is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
